title: Midjourney
content:
{{Short description|Image-generating machine learning model}} {{Infobox software | name = Midjourney | logo = Midjourney Emblem.png | logo caption = Logo | screenshot = Rupert Breheny mechanical dove eca144e7-476d-4976-821d-a49c408e4f36.png | screenshot size = 250px | caption = A "mechanical dove" created with the latest iteration of Midjourney's algorithm. | developer = Midjourney, Inc. | released = {{Start date and age|2022|7|12}} (open beta) | latest release version = | latest release date = | repo = | programming language = | operating system = | genre = | license = | website = {{url|https://www.midjourney.com/|midjourney.com}} }} {{Artificial intelligence}} '''Midjourney''' is a [[generative artificial intelligence]] program and service created and hosted by a [[San Francisco]]-based independent research lab Midjourney, Inc. Midjourney [[text-to-image model|generates images from natural language descriptions]], called "[[Prompt engineering|prompts]]", similar to [[OpenAI]]'s [[DALL-E]] and [[Stable Diffusion]].{{cite news |title=Huge "foundation models" are turbo-charging AI progress |url=https://www.economist.com/interactive/briefing/2022/06/11/huge-foundation-models-are-turbo-charging-ai-progress |newspaper=The Economist |access-date=26 June 2022}}{{cite web |last1=Hertzmann |first1=Aaron |title=Give this AI a few words of description and it produces a stunning image – but is it art? |url=https://theconversation.com/give-this-ai-a-few-words-of-description-and-it-produces-a-stunning-image-but-is-it-art-184363 |website=The Conversation |access-date=26 June 2022 |language=en}} The tool is currently in [[open beta]], which it entered on July 12, 2022.{{Cite tweet |number=1547108864788553729 |user=midjourney |title=We're officially moving to open-beta! Join now at https://discord.gg/midjourney. **Please read our directions carefully** or check out our detailed how-to guides here: https://midjourney.gitbook.io/docs. Most importantly, have fun! |date=July 12, 2022 |access-date=August 31, 2022}} The Midjourney team is led by [[David Holz]], who co-founded [[Leap Motion]].{{cite news |last1=Rose |first1=Janus |title=Inside Midjourney, The Generative Art AI That Rivals DALL-E |url=https://www.vice.com/en/article/wxn5wn/inside-midjourney-the-generative-art-ai-that-rivals-dall-e |publisher=[[Vice (magazine)|Vice]] |date=July 18, 2022}} Holz told ''[[The Register]]'' in August 2022 that the company was already profitable.{{cite news |last1=Claburn |first1=Thomas |title=Holz, founder of AI art service Midjourney, on future images |url=https://www.theregister.com/2022/08/01/david_holz_midjourney/ |access-date=September 5, 2022 |work=The Register |date=August 1, 2022 |language=en}} Users create artwork with Midjourney using [[Discord]] bot commands.{{cite news |last1=Hachman |first1=Mark |title=Midjourney's enthralling AI art generator goes live for everyone |url=https://www.pcworld.com/article/820518/midjourneys-ai-art-goes-live-for-everyone.html |access-date=September 5, 2022 |work=PCWorld |date=July 26, 2022 |language=en}} ==History== Midjourney, Inc. was founded in San Francisco, [[California]] by David Holz,{{Cite web |last=Salkowitz |first=Rob |date=2022-09-16 |title=Midjourney Founder David Holz On The Impact Of AI On Art, Imagination And The Creative Economy |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/robsalkowitz/2022/09/16/midjourney-founder-david-holz-on-the-impact-of-ai-on-art-imagination-and-the-creative-economy/ |access-date=2023-03-19 |website=Forbes |language=en}} previously co-founder of Leap Motion.{{Cite web |last=Vincent |first=James |date=2022-08-02 |title=“An engine for the imagination”: an interview with David Holz, CEO of AI image generator Midjourney |url=https://www.theverge.com/2022/8/2/23287173/ai-image-generation-art-midjourney-multiverse-interview-david-holz |access-date=2023-03-19 |website=The Verge |language=en-US}} The Midjourney image generation platform first entered open beta on July 12, 2022. However, on March 14, 2022, the Discord server launched with a request to post high-quality photographs to Twitter/Reddit for system's training. === Model versions === The company has been working on improving its algorithms, releasing new model versions every few months. Version 2 of their algorithm was launched in April 2022{{Cite tweet |number=1516138949219024898 |user=midjourney |title=We recently started testing a V2 algorithm, it's much better with characters and animals |date=2022-04-18 |access-date=2023-03-19}} and version 3 on July 25.{{Cite tweet |number=1551560891254001664 |user=midjourney |title=Today we're starting to test our V3 image generation algorithms |date=2022-07-25 |access-date=2023-03-19}} On November 5, 2022, the alpha iteration of version 4 was released to users{{Cite web |date=2022-11-05 |title=David Holz on the official Midjourney Discord server |url=https://discord.com/channels/662267976984297473/952771221915840552/1038335529747480607 |access-date=2023-03-19 |website=Discord}}{{Cite web |title=Midjourney v4 greatly improves the award-winning image creation AI |url=https://www.techspot.com/news/96619-midjourney-v4-greatly-improves-award-winning-image-creation.html |access-date=2022-11-17 |website=TechSpot |language=en-US}} and on March 15, 2023, the alpha iteration of version 5 was released.{{Cite web |title=Midjourney V5 Creates Better Images, Fewer Nightmare Hands |url=https://www.howtogeek.com/879711/midjourney-v5-creates-better-images-fewer-nightmare-hands/ |access-date=2023-03-16 |website=HowToGeek |language=en-US}} The 5.1 model is more 'opinionated' than version 5, applying more of its own stylization to images, while the 5.1 RAW model adds improvement while working better with more literal prompts. {| | style="vertical-align: top;" | {| class="wikitable" align="center" ! colspan="2" | Regular models |- ! Version !! Release date |- | V1 || February 2022{{Cite web |title=Midjourney Model Versions |url=https://docs.midjourney.com/docs/model-versions |access-date=2023-04-07 |website=docs.midjourney.com |language=en}} |- | V2 || April 12, 2022 |- | V3 || July 25, 2022 |- | V4 || November 5, 2022 (alpha) |- | V5 || March 15, 2023 (alpha) |- | V5.1 || May 3, 2023{{Cite web |last=Collins |first=Barry |date=2023-05-03 |title=Midjourney 5.1 Arrives - And It’s Another Leap Forward For AI Art |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/barrycollins/2023/05/03/midjourney-51-arrivesand-its-another-leap-forward-for-ai-art/ |access-date=2023-05-05 |website=Forbes |language=en}} |} | style="vertical-align: top;" | :{| class="wikitable" align="center" ! colspan="3" | Other models |- ! Version !! Release date !! Notes |- | --beta || August 22, 2022 || |- | test/testp || August 28, 2022 || |- | Niji || December 20, 2022 || rowspan="2" | Collaboration between Midjourney and Spellbrush
tuned to produce [[anime]] and illustrative styles |- | Niji 5 || April 2, 2023 |} |} ==Functionality== Midjourney is currently only accessible through a Discord bot on their official Discord server, by direct messaging the bot, or by inviting the bot to a third party server. To generate images, users use the {{code|/imagine}} command and type in a prompt; the bot then returns a set of four images. Users may then choose which images they want to [[Image scaling|upscale]]. Midjourney is also working on a web interface. ==Uses== Founder David Holz says he sees artists as customers, not competitors of Midjourney. Holz told ''The Register'' that artists use Midjourney for [[rapid prototyping]] of artistic concepts to show to clients before starting work themselves. Some artists have accused Midjourney of devaluing original creative work by using it in the [[Training, validation, and test data sets|training set]]; Midjourney's terms of service includes a [[Digital Millennium Copyright Act|DMCA]] takedown policy, allowing artists to request their work to be removed from the set if they believe [[copyright infringement]] to be evident.{{Cite web |title=Terms of Service |url=https://docs.midjourney.com/docs/terms-of-service |access-date=2023-03-19 |website=Midjourney |language=en}} The advertising industry has been quick to embrace AI tools such as Midjourney, DALL-E, and Stable Diffusion, among others. The tools, which enable advertisers to create original content and brainstorm ideas quickly are providing new opportunities such as "custom ads created for individuals, a new way to create special effects, or even making e-commerce advertising more efficient", according to ''[[Ad Age]]''.{{Cite web |last=Bonilla |first=Brian |date=2022-09-22 |title=How ad agencies are using AI image generators—and how they could be used in the future |url=https://adage.com/article/agency-news/how-agencies-use-ai-image-generators-dalle-e-2-midjourney-and-stable-diffusion/2430126 |access-date=2023-03-19 |website=Ad Age |language=en}} ===Notable usage and controversy=== {{external media | float = right | width = 300px | image1 = [https://www.liberation.fr/resizer/Pn9RvKgk0v-CTyhuXAhk2EE7fP0=/600x0/filters:format(jpg):quality(70):focal(774x418:784x428)/cloudfront-eu-central-1.images.arcpublishing.com/liberation/NRFKWQBPSRDNNDA6ZDNBIYGZCM.jpg Fake images involving personalities and created with Midjourney become viral (March 2023) : President Macron collecting rubbish, Donald Trump stopped by police officers, the Pope dressed in a white down jacket...].[https://www.liberation.fr/politique/photos-creees-par-des-ia-une-bascule-vertigineuse-et-dangereuse-20230331_G3ZTL7HYTVEENMQ5DBJ7VT3FJQ/ Photos créées par des IA : une bascule vertigineuse et dangereuse], Jonathan Bouchet-Petersen, 31 March 2023, ''[[Libération]]''. }} The program was used by the British magazine ''[[The Economist]]'' to create the front cover for an issue in June 2022.{{cite news |title=How a computer designed this week's cover |url=https://www.economist.com/news/2022/06/11/how-a-computer-designed-this-weeks-cover |access-date=26 June 2022 |newspaper=The Economist}}{{cite web |last1=Liu |first1=Gloria |title=DALL-E 2 Made Its First Magazine Cover |url=https://www.cosmopolitan.com/lifestyle/a40314356/dall-e-2-artificial-intelligence-cover/ |website=Cosmopolitan |access-date=26 June 2022 |date=21 June 2022}} In Italy, the leading newspaper ''[[Corriere della Sera]]'' published a comic created with Midjourney by writer Vanni Santoni in August 2022.{{cite news |last=Bozzi |first=Ida |date=2022-08-26 |title=Su "La Lettura", Highsmith inedita e le città che mutano |newspaper=Corriere della Sera |language=it-IT |url=https://www.corriere.it/la-lettura/22_agosto_26/su-la-lettura-highsmith-inedita-citta-europee-trasformazione-af21cf38-2522-11ed-9c55-2dc9b0266fc8.shtml |access-date=2023-03-19}} Charlie Warzel used Midjourney to generate two images of [[Alex Jones]] for Warzel's newsletter in ''[[The Atlantic]]''. The use of an AI-generated cover was criticised by people who felt it was taking jobs from artists. Warzel called his action a "mistake" in an article about his decision to use generated images.{{Cite web |date=2022-08-17 |title=I Went Viral in the Bad Way |url=https://newsletters.theatlantic.com/galaxy-brain/62fc502abcbd490021afea1e/twitter-viral-outrage-ai-art/ |access-date=2022-08-31 |website=Galaxy Brain |language=en}} ''[[Last Week Tonight with John Oliver]]'' included a 10-minute segment on Midjourney in an episode broadcast in August 2022.{{cite news |last1=SFGATE |first1=Dan Gentile |title=John Oliver is weirdly popular on this SF-based AI image app |url=https://www.sfgate.com/streaming/article/hbo-john-oliver-ai-midjourney-17374718.php |access-date=August 31, 2022 |work=SFGATE |date=August 16, 2022}}{{cite news |last1=Brathwaite |first1=Lester Fabian |title=John Oliver marries a cabbage in ceremony officiated by Steve Buscemi on 'Last Week Tonight' |url=https://ew.com/tv/john-oliver-marries-cabbage-steve-buscemi/ |access-date=August 31, 2022 |work=EW.com |date=August 29, 2022 |language=en}} A Midjourney image called ''[[Théâtre d'Opéra Spatial]]'' won first place in the digital art competition at the 2022 [[Colorado State Fair]]. Jason Allen, who wrote the [[Prompt engineering|prompt]] that led Midjourney to generate the image, printed the image onto a canvas and entered it into the competition using the name "Jason M. Allen via Midjourney". Other digital artists were upset by the news.{{cite news |last1=Gault |first1=Matthew |title=An AI-Generated Artwork Won First Place at a State Fair Fine Arts Competition, and Artists Are Pissed |url=https://www.vice.com/en/article/bvmvqm/an-ai-generated-artwork-won-first-place-at-a-state-fair-fine-arts-competition-and-artists-are-pissed |access-date=August 31, 2022 |work=Motherboard |publisher=Vice |date=August 31, 2022 |language=en}} Allen was unapologetic, insisting that he followed the competition's rules. The two category judges were unaware that Midjourney used AI to generate images, although they later said that had they known this, they would have awarded Allen the top prize anyway.{{cite news |last1=Roose |first1=Kevin |title=An A.I.-Generated Picture Won an Art Prize. Artists Aren't Happy. |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2022/09/02/technology/ai-artificial-intelligence-artists.html |access-date=September 2, 2022 |work=The New York Times |date=September 2, 2022}} In December 2022, Midjourney was used to create the images in an AI-generated [[Children's literature|children's book]] in the span of a weekend. Titled ''[[Alice and Sparkle]]'', the book features a young girl who builds a robot that becomes self-aware. The creator, Ammaar Reeshi, spent hours tweaking Midjourney prompts, rejecting hundreds of generated results to ultimately choose 13 illustrations for the book.{{Cite web |last=Stokel-Walker |first=Chris |date=13 December 2022 |title=A Tech Worker Is Selling A Children's Book He Made Using AI. Professional Illustrators Are Pissed. |url=https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/chrisstokelwalker/tech-worker-ai-childrens-book-angers-illustrators |access-date=19 December 2022 |website=[[BuzzFeed]] News}} Both the product and process drew criticism: “the main problem... is that it was trained off of artists’ work. It’s our creations, our distinct styles that we created, that we did not consent to being used," one artist wrote.{{Cite magazine |last=Popli |first=Nic |date=14 December 2022 |title=He Used AI to Publish a Children's Book in a Weekend. Artists Are Not Happy About It |url=https://time.com/6240569/ai-childrens-book-alice-and-sparkle-artists-unhappy/ |access-date=19 December 2022 |magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]]}} In 2023, the realism of AI-based [[Text-to-image model|Text-to-image]] generators, such as Midjourney, [[DALL-E]], or [[Stable Diffusion]],{{Cite web |last=Verma |first=Pranshu |last2=Schaul |first2=Kevin |title=See why AI like ChatGPT has gotten so good, so fast |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/interactive/2023/artificial-intelligence-tech-rapid-advances/ |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=Washington Post |language=en}}{{Cite web |date=2023-04-11 |title=Will AI-generated images create a new crisis for fact-checkers? Experts are not so sure |url=https://reutersinstitute.politics.ox.ac.uk/news/will-ai-generated-images-create-new-crisis-fact-checkers-experts-are-not-so-sure |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=Reuters Institute for the Study of Journalism |language=en}} reached such a high level of realism that it led to a significant wave of [[Viral phenomenon|viral]] AI-generated photos. Widespread attention was gained by a Midjourney-generated photo of [[Pope Francis]] wearing a white puffer coat,{{Cite web |last=Novak |first=Matt |title=That Viral Image Of Pope Francis Wearing A White Puffer Coat Is Totally Fake |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/mattnovak/2023/03/26/that-viral-image-of-pope-francis-wearing-a-white-puffer-coat-is-totally-fake/ |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=Forbes |language=en}}{{Cite web |last=Stokel-Walker |first=Chris |date=2023-03-27 |title=We Spoke To The Guy Who Created The Viral AI Image Of The Pope That Fooled The World |url=https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/chrisstokelwalker/pope-puffy-jacket-ai-midjourney-image-creator-interview |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=BuzzFeed News |language=en}} the fictional arrest of [[Donald Trump]],{{Cite web |date=2023-03-24 |title=Trump shares deepfake photo of himself praying as AI images of arrest spread online |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/us-politics/donald-trump-ai-praying-photo-b2307178.html |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=The Independent |language=en}} and a hoax of an attack on the [[The Pentagon|Pentagon]],{{Cite news |last=Oremus |first=Will |last2=Harwell |first2=Drew |last3=Armus |first3=Teo |date=2023-05-22 |title=A tweet about a Pentagon explosion was fake. It still went viral. |language=en-US |work=Washington Post |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/05/22/pentagon-explosion-ai-image-hoax/ |access-date=2023-05-28 |issn=0190-8286}} as well as the usage in professional creative arts.{{Cite web |last=Kolirin |first=Lianne |date=2023-04-18 |title=Artist rejects photo prize after AI-generated image wins award |url=https://www.cnn.com/style/article/ai-photo-win-sony-scli-intl/index.html |access-date=2023-05-28 |website=CNN |language=en}} ==== Content moderation and censorship in Midjourney ==== Prior to May 2023, Midjourney implemented a moderation mechanism predicated on a "banned words" system. This method prohibited the use of language associated with explicit content, such as sexual or pornographic themes, as well as extreme violence. Moreover, the system also banned certain individual words including religious and political figures such as "Allah" or "Xi Jinping". This practice occasionally stirred controversy due to perceived instances of censorship within the Midjourney platform.{{Cite web |last=McFadden |first=Christopher |date=2023-04-03 |title=Midjourney will no longer let you generate images of Xi Jinping |url=https://interestingengineering.com/culture/midjourney-bans-xi-jinping-images |access-date=2023-05-21 |website=interestingengineering.com |language=en-US}} Commencing in May 2023, with subsequent updates post version 5, Midjourney transitioned to an AI-powered content moderation system. This advanced mechanism allowed for a more nuanced interpretation of user prompts by analyzing them in their entirety. It consequently facilitated the context-dependent use of words that had previously been prohibited. For instance, users can now prompt the AI to generate a portrait of "Xi Jinping". However, the system will prevent the generation of contentious images, such as depictions of global leaders, including Xi Jinping, in situations of arrest.{{Cite web |last=Bastian |first=Matthias |date=2023-05-03 |title=Midjourney now has an easy mode and a new AI moderation system |url=https://the-decoder.com/midjourney-now-has-an-easy-mode-and-a-new-ai-moderation-system/ |access-date=2023-05-21 |website=THE DECODER |language=en-US}} ==Litigation== On January 13, 2023, three artists – [[Sarah Andersen]], Kelly McKernan, and Karla Ortiz – filed a [[copyright infringement]] lawsuit against [[Stability AI]], Midjourney, and [[DeviantArt]], claiming that these companies have infringed the rights of millions of artists, by training AI tools on five billion images scraped from the web, without the consent of the original artists.{{Cite web |url=https://www.theverge.com/2023/1/16/23557098/generative-ai-art-copyright-legal-lawsuit-stable-diffusion-midjourney-deviantart |title=AI art tools Stable Diffusion and Midjourney targeted with copyright lawsuit |first=James |last=Vincent |date=2023-01-16 |website=The Verge |accessdate= }} The legal action was initiated in San Francisco by attorney [[Matthew Butterick]] in partnership with the Joseph Saveri Law Firm, which is coincidentally the same team presently challenging [[Microsoft]], [[GitHub]], and [[OpenAI]] (developer of [[ChatGPT]] and image synthesizer [[DALL-E|DALL-E 2]]) in court. The issue in the ongoing suit pertains to Copilot, an automated code generator that was trained on freely available online code, allegedly without obtaining appropriate permissions from the original engineers. == Subscription service == Midjourney has three subscription tiers,{{Cite web |title=Midjourney Subscription Plans |url=https://docs.midjourney.com/docs/plans |access-date=2023-03-19 |website=docs.midjourney.com |language=en}} and previously offered a free trial. As of April 2023, Midjourney, Inc. only offers a paid subscription service after temporarily closing free trial access because of high demand and trial abuse. It doesn't provide free access to the image generation services. Users have to pay either monthly or yearly to use the service. When the free trial was available, generating an image activated it. Trial users could make roughly 25 jobs before needing to subscribe to continue using it.{{Cite web |title=Midjourney Quick Start Guide |url=https://docs.midjourney.com/docs/quick-start |access-date=2023-03-19 |website=docs.midjourney.com |language=en}} == Gallery == File:Hutzêran Midjourney.png|alt= File:Warabouc midjourney.png|Warabouc, a mythological creature File:"the day before Mariam bought an internet-enabled PC" (Fictional Documentary Photography, made by the artist Joseph Ayerle with help of AI and Photoshop)).jpg|Fictional documentary photography of the early internet age File:"young Elon Musk stops playing Mars Marauder and starts coding web software" (fictional AI-generated Joseph Ayerle artwork).jpg|Fictional documentary photography of young Elon Musk File:Jesus Christ in watercolour.png|Jesus Christ in watercolour File:Abraham Lincoln in watercolour.png|Abraham Lincoln in watercolour File:Woman in watercolour 73.png|alt= File:Beleko midjourney.png|Crow File:Bile - IA Midjourney versión 1.png|alt= File:Ronin's Vigil.jpg|alt= File:Behigorri midjourney.png|alt= File:Nonbinary person in watercolour.png|alt= File:MountainsByDesignermadsen-dfbupea.png|alt= == See also == {{Commons|Category:Images generated by Midjourney|Images generated by Midjourney}} * [[15.ai]] * [[Artificial intelligence art]] * [[Character.ai]] * [[Computer art]] * [[DALL-E]] * [[DreamBooth]] * [[Generative art]] * [[NovelAI]] * [[Stable Diffusion]] * [[Synthography]] ==References== {{reflist|refs= {{cite web |work=Easy With AI |last=Steen|first=Charles |date=January 4, 2023 |title="Midjourney Is Allegedly Working on a Web Interface" |url=https://easywithai.com/news/midjourney-is-allegedly-working-on-a-web-interface/ }} }} ==External links== {{commonscat}} * {{official|https://www.midjourney.com/}} * [https://twitter.com/midjourney Official Twitter] * [https://discord.gg/midjourney Official Discord server] {{Differentiable computing}} {{Authority control}} [[Category:Text-to-image generation]] [[Category:Deep learning software applications]] [[Category:Unsupervised learning]] [[Category:Art controversies]] [[Category:Works involved in plagiarism controversies]]
